title: [$250] Make More Features animation more obvious and add tap target

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
## Problem We've seen user confusion when users go to add more features in the workspace editor not understanding what happens next. ## Solution 1. **Make feature tapable when enabled**. When a feature is enabled, we should make the left side of the container tapable to navigate to the feature while retaining the switch toggle to enable/disabled the feature 2. **Increase the timing of the animation to 10 seconds and change color to highlight color**. This'll ensure the highlight stays on the screen for longer increasing users visibility into the newly added feature. Current behavior: https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/62148250-d64a-4d64-a343-d6e3d32532f6 In addition to making the fade-out delay animation 10 seconds, let's make a color change to our `highlight` color, that way we standardize to other patterns we have. Let's leave the rest of the animation alone as it's working well, only the fade-out delay time and the color should be tweaked on this element. cc @Expensify/design @puneetlath

title: [$250] Upgrade the delete workspace flow to a non-blocking UI pattern

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
## Problem We updated the error pattern for when we delete workspaces in this recent PR: https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/64015. However we made it into a blocking pattern because it was difficult to figure out how to make it a non-blocking pattern for offline flows. Making the workspace deletion flow a blocking pattern makes the app less usable for users with bad internet connections, hindering our ability to attract a large user base and compete. ## Solution Make the pattern a non-blocking pattern. ### Behavior Pre-requisites: - User owns a workspace with three purchases and an annual subscription that has not expired. 1. Go to the workspaces page 2. Click on the kebab menu 3. Click `Delete` OR 1. Go to the workspace settings > Overview 2. Click `Delete` ## Expected Result: **Online** 1. User clicks `Delete` 2. A centered alert modal appears: ``` Delete workspace You can’t delete the workspace until the end of the annual subscription term. [Got it] ``` ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/442996f2-0201-43e5-82e3-16f0b6588c78) ___ **Offline** 1. User clicks `Delete` 2. The workspace is optimistically deleted (i.e appears at 50% opacity & strikethrough on the Workspaces page) 3. User comes back online 4. The RBR dismissible message is added in-line that reads: "You can’t delete the workspace until the end of the annual subscription term." 5. User dismisses the error message and it disappears ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ebd01d4e-1ccb-46c8-ac62-e7da191ddfad) ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/06468b57-10f0-4407-8f99-f11e827fe0c5) cc: @trjExpensify

Launch app 2. Login as admin 3. Go to workspace and invite 2 members - employee and approver 4. Go to workflow 5. Change the default admin approver to user approver who is invited in step3 Steps: 1. Launch app 2. As employee login 3. Go to employee workspace chat 4. Create 2 similar track manual distance expense to create duplicates 5. Tap review duplicates 6. Tap keep all 7. Note duplicates resolved 9. In mweb, log in as approver 10. Open the workspace chat 11. Note review duplicates is shown ## Expected Result: Review duplicates must not be shown for approver after employee resolved duplicates by tapping keep all. ## Actual Result: Review duplicates is shown for approver after employee resolved duplicates by tapping keep all. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd80f5a2-404a-4a44-a8bd-41177dff83a0 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.37-6 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/70048 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1950@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Navigate to "Workspaces" and open any workspace. 3. Tap on "Reports" 4. Enable report fields. (Upgrade workspace level if necessary) 5. Tap on "Add Field" 6. Add any name and select "List" as type. 7. Navigate to "List Values" 8. Add at least two values. 9. Long tap and select the just added values and delete them. 10. Note that after values are deleted, "0 selected" can still be seen on top. ## Expected Result: When deleting all the added list values, dropdown menu should change to "Add Values" again. ## Actual Result: "0 Selected" can still be seen on dropdown menu after deleting all the list values on a report field. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9becaa04-9015-413d-938c-27b3869d878e [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
